file_content.text: Engaging all weapons.
You are beaten, General.
I can't believe it. All this work, all this death, for naught.
I wish I could sit around and discuss where I went wrong, but a good leader always has an exit strategy--
Not so fast, General. I thought you might try to run.
This is the end for you, Faraire.
You're done, General.
I can always count on you, Quinn.
Well done, Captain.
I had this under control.
I didn't need help.
I just thought it would be prudent to cover all angles.
I surrender. I expect to be afforded the treatment promised to prisoners in the Treaty of Coruscant.
You're not my prisoner, you're my victim.
No. [Kill Faraire]
Aah!
Nice to see generals scream when they die just like anyone else.
You will be treated however Darth Baras wishes.
My master will decide.
No harm will come to you, General.
Don't worry.
Yes, well, I will gladly take the general into custody.
Which reminds me, I was very pleased that you captured General Frellka. He'd made my maneuvering here quite difficult.
I've sent you a little reward for his delivery. And I hope you will consider me a close ally.
Congratulations on the success of your mission. Taking down the War Trust is an incredible victory.
It is clear you are the future of the Empire, and I hope you will count me among your closest allies.
I may call on you someday, Hurdenn. Your unquestioned obedience will be expected.
Be ready if I need you.
Well, yes, of course, you can count on that.
The feeling is mutual, Hurdenn.
Most certainly.
You are insignificant to me.
You're not worthy.
Ah, yes, well, perhaps this will change your opinion of me.
As a show of support, I place Lieutenant Pierce under your command. He will be invaluable in your domination of the galaxy.
Works for me. Done what I can here on Taris. Glad you're willing to let me go, Hurdenn.
You're meant for greater things, Lieutenant. With me, you will fulfill your destiny.
Welcome.
Hurdenn's not giving you to me, I'm taking you.
I owe the Moff nothing.
That works, too.
You won't be disappointed.
Makes no difference to me--just another mouth to feed.
Who cares?
I'll prove my worth to you, my lord.
Lieutenant, fall in. I will brief you on how things work here when we are back on the ship.
Can't wait.
It's time for you to join the rest of the War Trust, Faraire.
Quite the contrary. After you took down my fellows, I knew my only chance was to delay you.
And my gambit has paid off. I bought enough time for my technicians to solve how to stabilize Siantide cells of any kind.
The future is upon us, Sith, and you have the privilege of bearing witness....
Enemy sighted. Weapon systems targeted and locked.
I've handled war droids before.
I'm not afraid.
Not like these you haven't.
All this posturing is unnecessary.
You should relax.
Until now, it's been the Empire that enjoyed flexing its muscles. With this new power source, it's our turn.
You're quite a showman, Faraire.
Nice entrance.
This is nothing.
Siantide technology increases the strength of whatever it powers tenfold. The Republic fleet and arsenal will make your weapons obsolete.
The Empire will have no choice but to surrender--which you should do now.
How about I attack instead?
I have a better idea. [Attack]
Escalation never leads to peace.
Arms wars only exacerbate.
I've abandoned such naive notions, Sith. The Empire prepares for war and we cannot stand idle.
It is you who should surrender, General.
I'll make you the same offer.
And let the Empire gain this technology? Never.
Droids, full assault.
